titleStmt.title: John Donan et al. to James F. Robinson
CWG9027

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p: To the Governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

Your petitioners the undersigned would request that you pardon Traneda Bass now confined in the penitentiary believing that his case is one in which the pardoning power you have may be properly exercised

Jno. Donan
R A Dawson
B. L. Kerr
Wm A. Wilson,
J B Chapline
G W Craddock
A D Clark
Thos J. Whitman
J W Fitzpatrick
T. H, Lagden
W F Gwin
M E Twyman
Jail T. Compton
Milton Beard
Phil Buckner
J Walden clk
J. P. Knight
Plesant Perkins
John Driscoll
Dennis Logsdon
Jesse Fugua
C C Burks
W A H Pitt
Wm Richardson
Jans Goin
David Waddle
Thos Hardy
ColWillis Reynolds
John L Garvin
N Harper
Wm N Kunkill
F Reynolds
S B. Kennedy
Fielding J Parding
Cafe Hardin
S G N Loocky
Wm Glenn
A Sordon
James Dyer
James Butler
Isaacs Clark
Gideon Saygens
Wm B Richardson
Ab Wilkerson
Sam Craddock
No evidence to facts -- nothing to justify pardon
